data.title: Mylène Jampanoi – Biography, Net Worth, Age, Weight, Height, Relationships
data.meta_description: French model, actress, brand ambassador, web personality, media personality, businesswoman, and social media celebrity Mylène Jampanoi is well-known. She
data.text:
French model, actress, brand ambassador, web personality, media personality, businesswoman, and social media celebrity Mylène Jampanoi is well-known.

She rose to fame after starring in the slasher movie Martyrs. Several television programs and short films have featured Mylène Jampano. She represents Asia for Dior Snow cosmetics.

What is the Net Worth of Mylène Jampanoi? Salary, Earnings

Mylène Jampano makes a solid livelihood from several different jobs. She makes between $40–$50k (roughly) from her acting profession.

She is paid by Dior Snow Cosmetics as well. Mylène’s net worth is thought to be between USD 4 and $5 million.

Where was Mylène Jampanoï born? Ethnicity, Nationality, Family, Education

On July 12, 1980, Mylène Jampano was born in Aix-en-Provence, Bouches-du-Rhône, France. Currently, she resides in Paris, France. She goes under the name Léna Jam-Panoi.

Mylène’s mother is French Breton, while her father is Asian, according to her IMDB biography.

Her parents have seen pictures of her, but she hasn’t divulged their names or jobs. Her heroes are her grandparents.

Jampano hasn’t mentioned her siblings at all. Due to her parents’ diverse ethnic backgrounds, she has a mixed ethnic heritage and practices Christianity.

She signed up for a local school to finish her elementary schooling. Jampanoi graduated from a prominent college with her high school graduation.

While in college, she participated in several modeling contests.

Quick facts:

Full Real Name Mylène Jampanoï. Other Name Léna Jam-Panoï. Date of Birth 12 July 1980. Age (as of 2020) 40 years old. Current Residence Paris, France. Place of Birth Aix-en-Provence, Bouches-du-Rhône, France. Profession Model, Actress, and social media star. Net worth USD 4-5 Million (approx.). Religion Christianity. Ethnicity Mixed. Hair Color Brown. Hair Length Medium. Education High School Graduate. School/College Homeschooling. Nationality French. Zodiac Sign Cancer. Height (approx.) In: Feet Inches: 5′ 4″.

Meters: 1.63 m.

Centimeters: 163 cm. Weight (approx.) In Kilograms: 52-56 kg.

In Pounds: 114-123 lbs. Eye Color Green.

Is Mylène Jampanoï Married ? Relationship

For two to three years, Mylène Jampano was dating Milind Soman. Indian model, actor, and television program host Milind Soman.

They initially met while filming “Valley of Flowers” on location. They begin dating one another.

In Goa, India, Milind, and Mylene were wed in 2006; nevertheless, they divorced in 2009. Although the cause of the divorce is unknown, rumors claim that the couple split up because of distance.

Jampano had to stay in Paris for business purposes, and Milind had to stay in India for the same reason.

We learned about Mylène and Dimitri Stephanides’ ten-year relationship after looking through her Instagram. This year marks the couple’s tenth wedding anniversary.

Jampano is happy with him and wants to continue their friendship.

A single son is raised by Mylène Jampano. Andreas Vassily was his name. He is somewhere between 7 and 8 years old. Until June 2021. Jampanoi adores her baby and gives him the best care possible.

How did Mylène Jampanoï start her Professional Career?

In 2001, Mylène Jampano made her television debut on the French program “Sous le Soleil.” “Under the Sun” Up until 2003, she was a cast member on this program.

She rose to fame in 2008 thanks to her performance as Lucie in the slasher movie Martyrs. This movie was directed by Pascal Laugier.

Catherine Bégin, Patricia Tulasne, Morjana Alaoui, Robert Toupin, Juliette Gosselin, and others co-starred with her in the starring role.

In the 2010 movie “Hereafter,” Clint Eastwood served as the director. She was chosen to play the reporter Jasmine in the play. In 2019, she had an appearance in Julien Abraham’s movie “Made in China.”

She also appeared in the movie “True Love.” Jampano is presently developing “Undercover,” her debut full-length motion picture.
